intro: Lathyrus lanszwertii var. lanszwertii, commonly known as the Hungarian vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from pink to violet, which bloom in early summer. Its root system is notable for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. This species is native to Central and Eastern Europe and is often found in meadows and grasslands.
